detaileddescription.para: Lobatto IIIC second-order method (2 stages)
Get the matrix $ \mathbf{A} $.
Set the matrix $ \mathbf{A} $.
Get the weights vector $ \mathbf{b} $ (row vector).
Set the weights vector $ \mathbf{b} $ (row vector).
Get the nodes vector $ \mathbf{c} $ (column vector).
Set the nodes vector $ \mathbf{c} $ (column vector).

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in A, in b, in c)
memberdef.name: set_tableau

detaileddescription.para: Set the Butcher tableau.

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in x_k, in K, in t_k, in d_t)
memberdef.name: step_residual

detaileddescription.para: Compute the LHS of the system of equations to be solved $ \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}_k + dt \sum{a_{ij} K_j}, \mathbf{K}, t_k + c_i dt) = \mathbf{0} $

parameterdescription.para: States value at $ k $-th time step $ \mathbf{x}(t_k) $.
$ \mathbf{K} $ variable of the system to be solved.

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in x_k, in K, in t_k, in d_t)
memberdef.name: step_jacobian

detaileddescription.para: Compute the Jacobian of the LHS of the system of equations to be solved $ \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}_k + dt \sum{a_{ij} K_j}, \mathbf{K}, t_k + c_i dt) = 0 $ in the $ \mathbf{K} $ variable:
\[ \frac{\partial\mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}_k + dt \sum{a_{ij} K_j}, \mathbf{K}, t_k + c_i dt)}{\partial \mathbf{K}} \].

parameterdescription.para: States value at $ k $-th time step $ \mathbf{x}(t_k) $.
$ \mathbf{K} $ variable of the system to be solved.

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in x_k, in K0, in t_k, in d_t)
memberdef.name: solve_step

detaileddescription.para: Solve the implicit step $ \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}_k + dt \sum{a_{ij} K_j}, \mathbf{K}, t_k + c_i dt)=\mathbf{0} $ by Newton method.

parameterdescription.para: States value at $ k $-th time step $ \mathbf{x}(t_k) $.
Initial guess for the $ \mathbf{K} $ variable of the system to be solved.

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in x_k, in x_dot_k, in t_k, in d_t)
memberdef.name: step

detaileddescription.para: Compute an integration step using the implicit Runge-Kutta method for a system of ODEs of the form $ \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{x}', t) = \mathbf{0} $.
Consider a Runge-Kutta method, written for a system of ODEs of the form $ \mathbf{x}' = \mathbf{f}(\mathbf{x}, t) $:

para.formula: \[ \begin{array}{l} \mathbf{K}_i = \mathbf{f} \left( \mathbf{x}_k + \Delta t \displaystyle\sum_{j=1}^{s} a_{ij} \mathbf{K}_j, \, t_k + c_i \Delta t \right), \qquad i = 1, 2, \ldots, s \\ \mathbf{x}_{k+1} = \mathbf{x}_k + \Delta t \displaystyle\sum_{j=1}^s b_j \mathbf{K}_j \, , \end{array} \]

detaileddescription.para: Then the implicit Runge-Kutta method for an implicit system of ODEs of the form $\mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{x}', t) = \mathbf{0} $ can be written as:

para.formula: \[ \begin{array}{l} \mathbf{F}_i \left( \mathbf{x}_k + \Delta t \displaystyle\sum_{j=1}^{s} a_{ij} \mathbf{K}_j, \, \mathbf{K}_i, \, t_k + c_i \Delta t \right) = \mathbf{0}, \qquad i = 1, 2, \ldots, s \\ \mathbf{x}_{k+1} = \mathbf{x}_k + \displaystyle\sum_{j=1}^s b_j \mathbf{K}_j. \end{array} \]

detaileddescription.para: Thus, the final system to be solved is the following:

para.formula: \[ \left\{\begin{array}{l} \mathbf{F}_1 \left( \mathbf{x}_k, \, \mathbf{K}_1, \, t_k \right) = \mathbf{0} \\ \mathbf{F}_2 \left( \mathbf{x}_k + \Delta t \, a_{21} \mathbf{K}_1, \, \mathbf{K}_2, \, t_k + c_2 \Delta t \right) = \mathbf{0} \\ ~~ \vdots \\ \mathbf{F}_s \left( \mathbf{x}_k + \Delta t \displaystyle\sum_{j=1}^{s-1} a_{sj} \mathbf{K}_j, \, \mathbf{K}_s, \, t_k + c_s \Delta t \right) = \mathbf{0} \end{array}\right. \]

detaileddescription.para: The $ \mathbf{K}_i $ variable are computed using the Newton's method.

The suggested time step for the next advancing step $ \Delta t_{k+1} $, is the same as the input time step $ \Delta t $ since in the implicit Runge-Kutta method the time step is not modified through any error control method.

parameterdescription.para: States value at $ k $-th time step $ \mathbf{x}(t_k) $.
States derivative at $ k $-th time step $ \mathbf{x}' (t_k) $.

Notice that $ \delta\mathbf{x} $ is the solution of the linear system:

The time $ t $ at which the states are evaluated.

memberdef.argsstring: (in this, in t, in x_0, in varargin)
memberdef.name: solve

detaileddescription.para: Solve the system of ODEs/DAEs and calculate the approximate solution.

parameterdescription.para: [optional, default = false] Apply projection to invariants at each step.
[optional, default = $ 1.0\mathrm{e}3 $] If $ || \mathbf{x} ||_{\infty} > \varepsilon $ the computation is interrupted.

simplesect.para: A matrix $ \left[(\mathrm{size}(\mathbf{x}) \times \mathrm{size} (\mathbf{t})\right] $ containing the approximated solution $ \mathbf{x}(t) $ of the system of ODEs/DAEs.

detaileddescription.para: Solve without the solution projection on invariants/hidden constraints and disabled verbose mode.

para.verbatim: embed:rst:leading-asterisk * .. code-block:: none * * sol = obj.solve(t, x_0); * *

detaileddescription.para: Solve with the solution projection on invariants/hidden constraints and disabled verbose mode.

para.verbatim: embed:rst:leading-asterisk * .. code-block:: none * * sol = obj.solve(t, x_0, true); * *

detaileddescription.para: Solve without the solution projection on invariants/hidden constraints and enabled verbose mode.

para.verbatim: embed:rst:leading-asterisk * .. code-block:: none * * sol = obj.solve(t, x_0, false, true); * *

Maximum number of iterations in the projection process.

simplesect.para: True if the Butcher tableau is consistent, false otherwise.
